did.abstract: Map created by a soldier in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1919, the "Polar Bear Expedition."

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Alex Heath, of Preston, Idaho, in 1963 (Donor No. 4052).

accruals.p: No further additions to the collection are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box. no., Lines of communications (Dvina) station chart. [1919?], Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Alex Heath was a resident of Lansing, Michigan, who served in the U.S. Army Expeditionary Force to North Russia, in Co. F, 339th Infantry.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains a map (not drawn to scale) collected by Heath showing the area south of Archangel, Russia, along railroad and Dvina River, between Bakaritza and Obozerskaya, Kodish and Beresniki.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army. Infantry, 339th. Company B--Maps.
